msbt.message: Guess they got the "crab" part rightbut that thing doesn't look like a horseshoe at all!
Now if that ain't the least-appetizin' pineapple I've ever seen
Turns out this here lobster is some kind of Rock Paper Scissors genius.It ain't picked nothin' but scissors in over roundsand I still keep losin', !Maybe I've lost my touch
Wow! Just look at the size of that gigas giant clam, !I'm having a hard time staying clam here.<10_4 /> Uhcalm. I meant to say calm.
An umbrella octopus, huh? Gotta be a serious umbrella to stay dry under THAT much water,
Well now, it's quite an honor to be in the presence of His Highness the red king crab, .It ain't often we get royalty visitin' .
I just don't know what to make of this here moon jellyfish. The way it's all flimsy and see-throughGives me the willies, .
What if a chambered nautilus wants itself a bigger shell?Think there's like aTom Nautilus or somethin' out there he can wrangle a loan from, ?
Well, as long as they ain't spinnin' webs for me to walk face first into, then spider crabs are alright by me.
Considerin' the sea creatures that get called "giant," I guess I figured a giant isopod'd begiant-er.
Did I hear right? You donated this fine specimen? That's some fine divin' skill you got, .
